description: Explore sorting, searching, time complexity, and graph algorithms

slides.title: Introduction
slides.content:
# Algorithms üíª

## What is an Algorithm?
Step-by-step procedure to solve a problem.

## Topics
- Sorting algorithms
- Search algorithms
- Time complexity
- Graph algorithms

slides.title: Sorting
slides.content:
# Sorting Algorithms üìä

| Algorithm | Time (avg) | Space |
|-----------|------------|-------|
| Bubble | O(n¬≤) | O(1) |
| Merge | O(n log n) | O(n) |
| Quick | O(n log n) | O(log n) |
| Insertion | O(n¬≤) | O(1) |

## Stable vs Unstable
- Stable: Preserves equal element order
- Merge sort is stable

slides.title: Searching
slides.content:
# Search Algorithms üîç

## Linear Search
- O(n) time
- Works on unsorted

## Binary Search
- O(log n) time
- Requires sorted array
```
mid = (low + high) / 2
if target < arr[mid]: search left
else: search right
```

slides.title: Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: What is the time complexity of binary search?

slides.title: Big-O Notation
slides.content:
# Time Complexity ‚è±Ô∏è

## Common Complexities
| Notation | Name | Example |
|----------|------|--------|
| O(1) | Constant | Array access |
| O(log n) | Logarithmic | Binary search |
| O(n) | Linear | Linear search |
| O(n log n) | Linearithmic | Merge sort |
| O(n¬≤) | Quadratic | Bubble sort |

slides.title: Graph Algorithms
slides.content:
# Graph Algorithms üîó

## Traversal
- BFS: Level by level
- DFS: Deep first

## Shortest Path
| Algorithm | Use |
|-----------|-----|
| Dijkstra | Weighted, non-negative |
| Bellman-Ford | Negative weights |
| Floyd-Warshall | All pairs |

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Summary üéâ

- Sorting: O(n¬≤) vs O(n log n)
- Binary search: O(log n)
- BFS/DFS for graph traversal
- Big-O measures efficiency
